author: mrabino1
content: quick (basic) question... post merge, re 1559 what tools / constraints / advice will be provided for then validators to set their own gas limit knowing 1559 will try to harmonize on 50% of that limit  (i believe this is how this will work). ... ami ask in this thread as it is gas limit and 1559 related.....

author: mrabino1
content: i get the impression it could be all over the place on gas limits (and whether i want to admit it or not, miners have done a good job at being organized thus far on the gas limit)

author: sky.cactus
content: The recommendation for miners is to double their configured gas limit around the hard fork block.  Can be before or after, and it isn't the end of the world if the gas limit fluctuates a bit around the fork.

author: perama
content: Post-merge a validator who produces a block will decide on a gas limit in the same way that a miner would do it before the merge

author: mrabino1
content: Agreed. I suppose my question / comment is really directed at the "way" that miners have thus organized the gas limit to my understanding has been mostly ad hoc (but decently coordinated). when we go to PoS to produce blocks that responsibility then shifts to this "blob" of validators.. many of them will do what they will do.. and that is fine.. that said, I do believe it wise to have an informal recommendation body (bordering on a committee) to provide guidance as to what is recommended for the then situation.

author: sky.cactus
content: When you said "post merge" I read "post release", sorry.  I thought you were talking about 1559 (since this is the 1559 channel).

author: sky.cactus
content: Nothing particularly interesting changes with regards to 1559 and The Merge.

author: sky.cactus
content: Block producers can hint at block size the same as today.  Clients will likely be shipped with reasonable defaults.

author: mrabino1
content: For example, the increase from 12.5MM to 15MM occurred and of couse no one needed to "approve" it.... at some point in the future, the situation may exist (post 1559) to expand to 35MM... what is the best way to roughly organize that?

author: mrabino1
content: Re the defaults, I believe the default is still at 7.5MM

author: sky.cactus
content: That is a more broad question unrelated to 1559 though.

author: mrabino1
content: i suspect we will need a gas limit recommendation channel .... thus far that has been organized by miners with recommendations from devs ...
